description: Starts the specified capacity task. You can have one active capacity task for each order and each Outpost.

parameters.name: OutpostIdentifier
parameters.description: The ID or ARN of the Outposts associated with the specified capacity task.

parameters.name: InstancePools
parameters.description: The instance pools specified in the capacity task. (dict) --- The instance type that you specify determines the combination of CPU, memory, storage, and networking capacity. The instance type of the hosts. The number of instances for the specified instance type.

nested_params.name: InstanceType
nested_params.description: The instance type of the hosts.

nested_params.name: Count
nested_params.description: The number of instances for the specified instance type.

parameters.name: InstancesToExclude
parameters.description: List of user-specified running instances that must not be stopped in order to free up the capacity needed to run the capacity task. Instances (list) --- List of user-specified instances that must not be stopped. (string) --- AccountIds (list) --- IDs of the accounts that own each instance that must not be stopped. (string) --- The ID of the Amazon Web Services account. Services (list) --- Names of the services that own each instance that must not be stopped in order to free up the capacity needed to run the capacity task. (string) ---

nested_params.name: Instances
nested_params.description: List of user-specified instances that must not be stopped.

nested_params.name: AccountIds
nested_params.description: IDs of the accounts that own each instance that must not be stopped.

nested_params.name: Services
nested_params.description: Names of the services that own each instance that must not be stopped in order to free up the capacity needed to run the capacity task.

parameters.name: TaskActionOnBlockingInstances
parameters.description: Specify one of the following options in case an instance is blocking the capacity task from running. WAIT_FOR_EVACUATION - Checks every 10 minutes over 48 hours to determine if instances have stopped and capacity is available to complete the task. FAIL_TASK - The capacity task fails.

nested_items.name: CapacityTaskId
nested_items.description: ID of the capacity task that you want to start.

nested_items.name: OutpostId
nested_items.description: ID of the Outpost associated with the capacity task.

nested_items.name: OrderId
nested_items.description: ID of the Amazon Web Services Outposts order of the host associated with the capacity task.

nested_items.name: AssetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the asset. An Outpost asset can be a single server within an Outposts rack or an Outposts server configuration.

nested_items.name: RequestedInstancePools
nested_items.description: List of the instance pools requested in the specified capacity task.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The instance type of the hosts.

nested_items.name: Count
nested_items.description: The number of instances for the specified instance type.

nested_items.name: InstancesToExclude
nested_items.description: User-specified instances that must not be stopped in order to free up the capacity needed to run the capacity task.

nested_items.name: Instances
nested_items.description: List of user-specified instances that must not be stopped.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AccountIds
nested_items.description: IDs of the accounts that own each instance that must not be stopped.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Services
nested_items.description: Names of the services that own each instance that must not be stopped in order to free up the capacity needed to run the capacity task.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: DryRun
nested_items.description: Results of the dry run showing if the specified capacity task is above or below the available instance capacity.

nested_items.name: CapacityTaskStatus
nested_items.description: Status of the specified capacity task.

nested_items.name: Reason
nested_items.description: The reason that the specified capacity task failed.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of failure.

nested_items.name: CreationDate
nested_items.description: Date that the specified capacity task was created.

nested_items.name: CompletionDate
nested_items.description: Date that the specified capacity task ran successfully.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedDate
nested_items.description: Date that the specified capacity task was last modified.

nested_items.name: TaskActionOnBlockingInstances
nested_items.description: User-specified option in case an instance is blocking the capacity task from running.
WAIT_FOR_EVACUATION - Checks every 10 minutes over 48 hours to determine if instances have stopped and capacity is available to complete the task.
FAIL_TASK - The capacity task fails.
